alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Cumberland; Eastern Louisa; Goochland; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway; Powhatan; Prince Edward; Western Louisa (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 22 at 3:23PM EDT until September 23 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Virginia, including the following areas, in central Virginia, Amelia, Cumberland, Eastern Louisa, Fluvanna, Goochland, Powhatan, Prince Edward and Western Louisa. In south central Virginia, Lunenburg, Mecklenburg and Nottoway. * WHEN...Through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain is expected to develop across central Virginia later this afternoon through Sunday morning as Tropical Storm Ophelia moves towards the area. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected with locally higher amounts possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Cumberland; Eastern Louisa; Goochland; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg; Nottoway; Powhatan; Prince Edward; Western Louisa
